intro: Lechea mucronata, commonly known as the mucronate lechea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Lechea mucronata is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in humid climates.
